metadata.Title: CVE-2020-12397 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
By encoding Unicode whitespace characters within the From email header, an attacker can spoof the sender email address that Thunderbird displays. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 68.8.0.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-12397` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:68.8.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:68.8.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:68.8.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:68.8.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:68.8.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
xul-ext-lightning - 1:68.8.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: thunderbird package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:68.8.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.2').
